alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills; Marin Coastal Range; North Bay Interior Mountains; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 27 at 6:13PM PDT until October 29 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... .North-northeast winds are expected to develop early Saturday morning across the ridges of the North Bay, East Bay, and the Santa Cruz Mountains. Dry, offshore winds will peak late Saturday into Sunday morning, which will result in elevated fire weather concerns. During the overnight hours, offshore winds could mix down into the interior valleys of the North Bay and East Bay. Gusts of 30 to 40 mph will be possible with locally higher gusts up to 50 to 60 mph across ridgetops and higher peaks. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SATURDAY TO 5 PM PDT SUNDAY FOR GUSTY OFFSHORE WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE ZONES 502,504,512,514,515... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 502 Marin Coastal Range, Fire Weather Zone 504 North Bay Interior Mountains, Fire Weather Zone 512 Santa Cruz Mountains, Fire Weather Zone 514 Eastern Santa Clara Hills and Fire Weather Zone 515 East Bay Hills. * WINDS...North 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Highest ridgetops and peaks may see gusts up to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity as low as 10 to 20 percent on Saturday and Sunday. Poor relative humidity recoveries overnight in the 20 to 40 percent range. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills; Marin Coastal Range; North Bay Interior Mountains; Santa Cruz Mountains
